name: rat

attributes.attribute: thought to have prophetic or precognitive powers
foretell a death in the family
seeing a rat or mouse in a sieve meant the likely death of someone at sea
swimming by when one was in a boat meant the likely death of someone at sea

sources: Briggs, Katherine M. The Folklore of the Cotswolds. London: B. T. Batsford Ltd., 1974, 127.
Monaghan, Patricia. The Encyclopedia of Celtic Mythology and Folklore. Checkmark Books, 2008.
text: The rat is a creature of British folklore. Though it is uncertain whether the Celts initially believed that rats and mice had magical abilities, a remnant of this belief may still be observed in the Cotswolds region of Britain, where they were considered to possess prophetic or precognitive powers. Leaving a house suddenly by rats or mice was perceived to be an omen of death in the family. While being in a boat, seeing rats swimming by, or seeing a rat or mouse in a sieve in Scotland, was a sign of the probable death of someone at sea.
